title: Grassroots Ascendant
outcome: After the amnesty upends BCI privileges, marginalized neighborhoods rally to form a Peoples’ Congress, taking over local administration and resource management. For two weeks, this grassroots order grows in strength, defying the Council’s weakened authority. However, corruption seeps in as some new elites exploit their temporary status. The Council attempts to curry favor and reassert control, but power remains with the neighborhoods as citizens begin reimagining city governance from the ground up.

events.description: Neighborhood coalitions convene a citywide 'Peoples’ Congress' to organize resource sharing, crisis response, and community governance in defiance of the weakened Council.
The Congress drafts and implements new rules for local administration; some former low-score residents use newfound power to settle scores or hoard resources.
Council launches a campaign to win back support by offering partial restoration of BCI-based privileges, but most citizens ignore the gesture.
Grassroots leaders expand influence, enforcing their own order as corruption begins to emerge. Tensions grow between old and new elites, leaving city governance in flux.
